 Candidate N o.:   60177     
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Location:    East UK – open to relocation         
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
• MEng Chemical Engineering (2:1) – University of Sheffield (2015 – 2019)  
       Key degree course modules were:  
- Research Project (Year 4) (65%)  
- Design Project (Year 3) (65%)  
- Advanced Chemical Engineering (Year 3) (61%)  
- Low Carbon Energy Science and Technology (Year 4) (71%)  
- Design for a Sustainable Environment (Year 4) (71 %)  
 
• Research Project – He investigated the potential for flocs formed by cheese and bread following being 
processed through a Food Waste Disposer (FWD) to cause blockages in sewer pipework. This involved:  
1. Determination and analysis of the size distribution  of the food types following processing through an FWD. 
2. Use of an agitator to analyse the shear stress at which the produced flocs break up and to identify if the flocs 
will break up in sewer systems.  
3. Use of a filtration method to find the size to w hich flocs had broken up and to show which food types still had 
the potential to cause blockages in sewer pipework.  
 
This project proved his ability to in -detail run a project from start to finish. He has the independence to complete 
an in -depth research r eport to a high -quality standard highlighting his technical abilities and independent lab 
work skills.  
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Feb 2020  to date  Present Company  
Position: Manufacturing Improvement Coordinator  
He began his role in manufacturing improvement in the compan y’s Manufacturing Excellence Team in February 
2020. He very quickly showed his ability to step up to the wide range of c hallenges he faced at the site which has 
only recently been taken over by  the company .  
• He has been able to engage and communicate successfully with many different people and demonstrated this 
to be one of his biggest strengths. He ha s had several  opportunities to use his technical skills in waste 
improvement projects and has quickly showed that he was a valuable addition to the team and the site.  
• He collated data on ingredients and waste which allowed him to combine yield, cost and volume th roughput to 
prioritise the most valuable ingredients, with biggest potential savings, for improvement focus.  
• He w as involved in a broccoli waste reduction project which targeted  the reduction in floor waste produced. 
These projects generated significant sa vings helping the team to regularly beat the weekly target by a 
considerable margin.  
• He has worked on data gathering and analysis for capital projects to identify trends and to predict potential 
savings and payback periods. He has investigated project risks and ho w to mitigate these.  
 
 
 
 
  
Industrial Placement Experience:  
 
Inovyn, Runcorn Site  (Jun 2017, Jul & Aug 2018)  
He collected and analysed data on the cooling water flowrates proving which heat exchangers needed to be 
replaced due to inefficiencies for the process team.  
 
In 2018 he returned to Inovyn for a full summer placement. As part of the project teams he complete d and led his 
own project to research the feasibility of a hydrogen purification project to produce fuel cell grade hydrogen to sell 
to local borough councils as a fuel for buses. He communicated with vendors to produce quotes for the purification 
unit, co mpressors and drier, produced a mass balance of the system, a Process Flow Diagram and a cost estimate 
based on Lang Factors. He put into practice and further developed many of the technical and leadership skills learnt 
from his 3rd year design project. He finished the project in the allocated time slot and delivered the results by 
presentation to the senior leadership team.  
 
He took part in a commercial project, performed pressure relief valve calculations, audits and basis of safety training 
activities a nd successfully juggled the high workload and deadline pressures. He has  experience in this high hazard 
chemical plant and ha s reviewed HAZOP documents, permit to work documents and COMAH case documents. 
The skills he showed were the ability to balance his time effectively and  deliver well rounded and completed

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
